data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3408069,"name":"Nikhil Marella","username":"jackfrostbob333","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e79b87/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-13T20:34:22.928Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’ve been testing out some pneumatic components to help my team learn how to use them effectively, and i discovered a really strange problem. I was using the analog sensor to control the compressor, and learned that the pneumatics hub would not detect the sensor when the Analog sensor was directly connected to the hub, but would detect it when i used an extension cord to connect it. I was wondering if anyone knew of a reason that this could happen to us or anyone in competition? attached are photos, one being the analog sensor connected directly, and the other being it connected through an extension wire.\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"lightbox-wrapper\"\u003e\u003ca class=\"lightbox\"
